paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants of BRCA2 with clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional information.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: BRCA2-T207A reduces the binding of DDX5 to the hybrids, leading to unresolved DNA-RNA hybrids and consequently less efficient repair of DSBs by HR.
The mitotic phenotype of cells expressing the same variant was studied by Ehlén and colleagues.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2-T207A variant affects the interaction with DDX5 and impairs DNA-RNA hybrid resolution, leading to reduced DSB repair efficiency.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: The T207A variant has been implicated in both mitotic function and DNA repair mechanisms.
key_quotes: BRCA2-T207A reduces the binding of DDX5 to the hybrids, leading to unresolved DNA-RNA hybrids and consequently less efficient repair of DSBs by HR.
The mitotic phenotype of cells expressing the same variant was studied by Ehlén and colleagues.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The C315S variant disrupts the association of the NTD with dsDNA that they showed was required for the stimulation of RAD51-mediated recombination.

functional_data.summary: C315S variant specifically reduces the dsDNA binding activity of the NTD without altering its ssDNA binding affinity.

variants.additional_notes: C315S is classified as benign/likely benign in the ClinVar database.
key_quotes: The C315S missense mutation specifically reduced the dsDNA binding activity of the NTD without altering its ssDNA binding affinity.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of BRCA2 variants discussed in the review.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
